OrgUsersConfig

OrgUsersConfig

A config file that stores usernames for an org.

Constructor

new OrgUsersConfig()

Extends

  • ConfigFile

Methods

(static) getDefaultOptions()

Do not use. Call OrgUsersConfig.getOptions instead.

(static) getOptions(orgId) → {ConfigOptions}

Gets the config options for a given org ID.

Parameters:
Name Type Description
orgId string

The orgId. Generally this org would have multiple users configured.
Returns:

The ConfigOptions.

Type
ConfigOptions

(async) access(perm) → {Promise.<boolean>}

Inherited From:
  • ConfigFile#access
See:
  • fs.access

Determines if the config file is read/write accessible.

Parameters:
Name Type Description
perm number

The permission.
Returns:

true if the user has capabilities specified by perm.

Type
Promise.<boolean>

Inherited From:

Asynchronously invokes actionFn once for each key-value pair present in the config object.

Name Type Description

(async) read(throwOnNotFoundopt) → {Promise.<object>}

Inherited From:
  • ConfigFile#read

Read the config file and set the config contents.

Parameters:
Name Type Attributes Default Description
throwOnNotFound boolean <optional>
 false

Optionally indicate if a throw should occur on file read.
Throws:

{name: 'UnexpectedJsonFileFormat'}: There was a problem reading or parsing the file.

Type
SfdxError
Returns:

The config contents of the config file.

unset(key) → {boolean}

Inherited From:
  • BaseConfigStore#unset

Returns true if an element in the config object existed and has been removed, or false if the element does not exist. BaseConfigStore.has(key) will return false afterwards.

Parameters:
Name Type Description
key string

The key.
Returns:
Type
boolean

unsetAll(keys) → {boolean}

Inherited From:
  • BaseConfigStore#unsetAll

Returns true if all elements in the config object existed and have been removed, or false if all the elements do not exist (some may have been removed). BaseConfigStore.has(key) will return false afterwards.

Parameters:
Name Type Description
keys Array.<string>

The keys.
Returns:
Type
boolean

(async) write(newContentsopt) → {Promise.<object>}

Inherited From:
  • ConfigFile#write

Write the config file with new contents. If no new contents are passed in it will write the existing config contents that were set from ConfigFile.read, or an empty file if ConfigFile.read was not called.

Parameters:
Name Type Attributes Description
newContents object <optional>

The new contents of the file.
Returns:

The written contents.

Type
Promise.<object>
